intro: Dendranthema hypargyrum, commonly known as the common chamomile, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow central disc. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has linear, hairy leaves that are aromatic when crushed. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The essential oil extracted from its flowers is widely used in herbal medicine and aromatherapy for its calming properties.
